text: One afternoon all the clocks in Anna's house paused at the same time, 3:33, and the air hummed softly.
scene: Anna in her living room looking at several clocks all stopped at 3:33, sunlight through the window

text: A golden train whistle sounded outside her window, and a small train made of brass gears rolled up on glowing tracks.
scene: tiny golden train on luminous tracks outside the window, steam curling, Anna peeking out

text: An owl conductor tipped his hat. "Time is stuck. We need a helper with steady hands," he hooted.
scene: kind owl in a conductor uniform offering a hat-tip to Anna beside the golden train

text: Anna climbed aboard. Each car held jars of floating moments, from morning sunbeams to evening fireflies.
scene: inside the train, shelves of glowing jars labeled with times of day, Anna walking down the aisle

text: Their first stop was a town stuck at dawn. The sky was pink forever, and people yawned sleepily.
scene: quiet town with endless sunrise, sleepy villagers stretching, train parked on a track

text: Anna wound the morning clock tower with a key from the owl, sending the sun slowly higher.
scene: Anna turning a large brass key on a clock tower, gears whirring, sun rays brightening

text: Next they reached a city stuck at lunchtime, shadows frozen under tall buildings.
scene: busy city square frozen at noon, people paused mid-bite, the golden train in the background

text: Anna adjusted the time crystal in the station, letting the shadows move and the bells ring.
scene: Anna carefully sliding a glowing time crystal into a slot, bells beginning to swing

text: Their next stop was a village stuck at sunset, everyone waiting to finish a picnic that never ended.
scene: village meadow with orange sky frozen, families mid-laughter, picnic blankets spread

text: She reset a sundial shaped like a sunflower. The sunflower spun, and the sky shifted to evening gently.
scene: Anna turning a sunflower sundial, petals spinning, sky shifting colors, villagers smiling

text: Finally they arrived at a harbor stuck at midnight, lanterns dim and stars fading.
scene: sleepy harbor under a stuck midnight sky, lanterns almost out, train on a small track nearby

text: The harbor clock was missing its moon hand. Anna searched the docks and found it stuck in a fishing net.
scene: Anna pulling a shiny crescent-shaped clock hand from a net, boats swaying gently

text: She climbed the tower and set the moon hand back. The stars twinkled awake one by one.
scene: Anna on a tower placing the moon hand into the clock face, stars brightening above

text: "There is one more task," the owl said. "Our train heart needs a tune."
scene: owl holding a small music box-shaped engine piece, Anna listening closely

text: Anna hummed the melody she heard when the clocks first stopped. The train heart chimed in perfect rhythm.
scene: Anna humming softly while placing the heart piece into the engine, golden gears spinning smoothly

text: Time flowed again. Villages finished dinners, cities stretched, and dawn towns finally saw the full morning.
scene: collage of towns moving again: people eating, kids playing, sun rising properly

text: The owl handed her a pocket watch that glowed with all colors. "For the one who kept time kind," he said.
scene: owl giving Anna a rainbow-glowing pocket watch inside the train car

text: As the train returned to her window, the clocks in her house ticked normally, right on time.
scene: small train outside her window, house clocks ticking, sunlight returning to the room

text: The glowing tracks faded, leaving only the soft tick of the pocket watch in her hand.
scene: Anna holding the pocket watch by the window, faint sparkles where the tracks were

text: She placed it on her nightstand. At 3:33, it winked once, as if saying thank you.
scene: close-up of the pocket watch on Anna's nightstand glowing briefly at 3:33, Anna smiling nearby
